hero.description: We build self-healing systems that scale naturally. No crashes. No exploding costs. Just a steady, uninterrupted flow.

philosophy.heroDescription: We don't believe in forcing technology. We build systems that adapt, heal themselves, and scale without resistance.

faq.title: Common questions
faq.subtitle: Technology is complex, but the answers don't have to be.

questions.question: Are your systems more expensive than 'regular' solutions?
questions.answer: Initially, the investment may be slightly higher than a standard WordPress template, yes. But over time? No. Our customers often reduce their operating costs by 50-80% because our systems require significantly less server power and less manual maintenance. It's cheaper to build it right once than to fix it every month.

questions.question: What technology do you build with?
questions.answer: We are technology agnostic but prefer BEAM (Erlang/Elixir) for systems that require extreme reliability and scalability. It's the same technology that powers WhatsApp and parts of 5G networks. For frontend, we use modern frameworks like React or Phoenix LiveView depending on needs.

questions.question: Do we have to replace everything we have?
questions.answer: Rarely. We believe in evolution, not revolution. Often we can build a 'streaming layer' that handles the heavy lifting, while your old systems can live on in the background until they are phased out naturally. We integrate seamlessly.

questions.question: How long does a project take?
questions.answer: A feasibility study often takes 1-2 weeks. A first MVP system (Minimum Viable Product) can often be ready in 4-8 weeks. Since we build modularly, we can deliver value quickly instead of waiting a year for a 'big bang' launch.

philosophyPage.title: The Flow Architects
philosophyPage.subtitle: We don't force systems to work. We orchestrate natural patterns where data, work, and energy flow freely.

intro.quote: Just like water engineers who harness rivers instead of fighting them, we design digital systems that embrace fundamental rhythms of data.
intro.paragraph1: Siteflow embodies the Flow Architect archetype. We understand that real power doesn't lie in forcing systems to work through brute force, but in understanding how data wants to move.
intro.paragraph2: We see beyond just ones and zeros to the deeper currents that connect human intent with machine capacity. Every system we build is a living ecosystem where information flows like water finding its optimal path – efficient, resilient, and surprisingly elegant.
